TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ContainerUIElement3D extends System.Windows.UIElement3D

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D.Children%2A> collection of a ContainerUIElement3D element can only consist of <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> objects. Adding a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> child to a ContainerUIElement3D implicitly adds it to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3DCollection> for the ContainerUIElement3D element.
ContainerUIElement3D does not have a visual representation; it serves as a container for other visual 3-D objects. ContainerUIElement3D is a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> object, which provides support for input, focus, and events in 3-D.
This class does not set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.Visual3DModel%2A> property.
ContainerUIElement3D is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples In the following example, the ContainerUIElement3D object contains two cubes as its children:
[!code-xml[ContainerModelSample#Viewport3D](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/ContainerModelSample/Window1.xaml#viewport3d)]
The following shows the event handler of the container:
[!code-vb[ContainerModelSample#ContainerMouseDown](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/containermodelsample/window1.xaml.vb#containermousedown)] [!code-cs[ContainerModelSample#ContainerMouseDown](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ContainerModelSample/Window1.xaml.cs#containermousedown)]
For the complete sample, see [Handling Events in 3-D Sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=159992) .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Children collection of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> element can only consist of <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> objects. Adding a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> child to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> implicitly adds it to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3DCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> element.
Children is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
